alert.note: Alert for Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 6:01PM CDT until July 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR MADISON COUNTY... At 601 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported flash flooding due to heavy rain from thunderstorms in Jackson. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jackson, Humboldt, Fairview, Three Way, Bemis, Carroll, Medina, Gilmore, Oakfield, East Union, Westover, Youngs Crossing, Maple Grove, Malesus, Windy City, Claybrook, Huntersville and Neely. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
